p: The effect of the fermented bioproduct that was fed to the poultry on the antioxidant activity and the fat oxidation of meat (expressed as malondialdehyde content) during storage for 7 days in the refrigerator is shown in Table 4. The results show that the antioxidant activity of the meat was not affected by the feeding of 10% FB and the results of the ability to scavenge-free DPPH radical was comparable in the control and experimental groups on the first and also the 7 th day of storage of the samples in the refrigerator. Sample storage for 7 days in the refrigerator caused a decrease in antioxidant activity of the meat ( P < 0.05) in both groups.
